alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 9:04PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Carroll, south central Jo Daviess, northeastern Clinton and southeastern Jackson Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 904 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Miles, or 14 miles west of Mount Carroll, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Island around 915 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforcement.
